intro: Retiniphyllum tepuiense, commonly known as the Tepui Begonia, is a unique flowering plant native to the tepuis of Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments at high altitudes, thriving in the rocky soils of the tepuis. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Due to its restricted habitat and rarity, Retiniphyllum tepuiense is considered a vulnerable species.
